title: Are you optimistic or pessimistic about the world's future? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are you optimistic or pessimistic about the world's future? Pessimistic but still a bit hopeful. In other words, when push comes to shove, some drastic changes will need to take place. This is because this question focuses on politics when one of the things that brought an end to the Roman Empire was economical in nature. For one, the Romans apparently experienced hyperinflation and the currency was being debased in terms of silver content. Our big, big problem in the modern day is the interest as a result of rising debt since the 1970s, which imposes a more then consequent burden on the world. It’s strange to see that political debates seemingly avoid the subject or not go into the causes.  Source

I’m optimistic for the future of the world… Once the short hiccup that is the only “intelligent’ species kills itself off, the earth can get back to being a little green and blue planet. I wish I could survive to see it. But if I survive then others will too, and the whole cycle would begin again.

I am optimistic++ — much to the displeasure of the pessimists of the world; and, let’s face it, there’s a whole hell of a lot more of those than there are of life-long unrepentant optimists like me. Too bad! After 65 years of being one, you’re not going to talk me out of it. I really like being happy; and I plan on continue being that way whether anyone else likes it or not.

As George Carlin said…”The World is doing fine…it’s humanity that is (in trouble)”. Our world has survived planetary collisions, earthquakes, hurricanes, ice ages, and meteor strikes. Nothing we can do can damage the Earth. We will be the ones who suffer the consequences of our actions while the world will spin on for billions of years after our departure.
